For pictures from past events:
http://www.harvardsqu...




MAYFAIR FILM PROGRAM presented by The Brattle Film Foundation!
12 Noon to 4 PM. Free and open to the public.

The Brattle has asked four of our favorite local film organizations to each program a block of shorts to be screened for free during Harvard Square's annual MayFair celebration! Lumen Eclipse, Central Productions, the Chlotrudis Society For Independent Film, and Women In Film/Video New England will each present some of their favorite shorts during this special program.

Programs run about 45 minutes and begin at the top of each hour. Please visit brattlefilm.org for more information.

The Brattle Theatre - 40 Brattle Street - 617-876-6837 - www.brattlefilm.org

The ReMax Destiny Hot Air Balloon will be giving rides during MayFair on the Cambridge Common during the afternoon of MayFair after 2:00 p.m. Please check in at the ReMax Booth for specific details. Charitable donations for rides will be given to CHAF and the Salvation Army?s Our Place daycare for homeless children.


KIDS FESTIVAL on CHURCH STREET offering kid-sized activities, healthy snacks, performances, face painting, and dancing in the streets including a KIDS CHALK ZONE, Thomas the Train rides, Matchbox car racing and opportunities to learn the latest DANCE MOVES!

CHALK ON THE WALK: Stroll Church Street when the entire block becomes a gallery of Chalk Art. Sponsored by the Cambridge Rotary and local businesses?last?s year?s business sponsored art works raised over $5,000 for local literacy programs!
item.why: its time for the truthers to do some truthing!

group.name: We Are Change Boston / Boston 9/11 Truth

item.name: Harvard Square May Fair Huge event for Truthing...
